definition: to brand/to iron/to bake (in a pan)

sentences.english: The upper and lower plates are both heated at the same time and pancakes do not need to turn the pot.
sentences.chinese: 先進的雙控電路加熱，上下盤同時加熱烙餅不需翻鍋。

sentences.english: And people there take the newly harvested wheat and make pancakes and steamed buns.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的人們會用剛剛收穫的小麥製作烙餅和饅頭。

sentences.english: We had a fine drink after our luchis that day.
sentences.chinese: 這一天我們喫過烙餅之後，喝上了很好的椰子水。

sentences.english: The town of Olney in Buckinghamshire, England is flipping for pancakes.
sentences.chinese: 英格蘭白金漢郡的奧爾尼鎮正爲烙餅而瘋狂。

sentences.english: Place the tortillas on a work surface and spread each generously with the sauce mixture(Step 1).
sentences.chinese: 將薄烙餅放平並塗上步驟1的混合醬。
友好的弗蘭克翻轉美味烙餅。

sentences.english: You, know. flapjack and a cigarette?

sentences.chinese: 喫用藍色玉米制作的薄烙餅。

sentences.english: How are the pancakes, Charlie Brown?
sentences.chinese: 烙餅怎麼樣了，查理布朗？

sentences.english: It's made from black beans, rice, optional soured cream, salsa and a corn tortilla.
sentences.chinese: 可選酸奶油，辣調味汁和玉米烙餅一起做成的。

sentences.english: My family loves pancakes, so I make them quite often.
sentences.chinese: 我的家人很喜歡喫烙餅，所以我經常做。

sentences.english: Turns out, oat flour makes terrific cookies and pancakes.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們就用了燕麥粉做很難喫的曲奇餅乾和烙餅。

definition: spring pancake, a Chinese flatbread wrap
soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
clear soup containing beaten egg and green leafy vegetable/eggdrop soup
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
